segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Process Creation, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when a process is created (starts).
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Process Creation, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when a process is created (starts).

segment.source: Audit Process Creation determines whether the operating system generates audit events when a process is created (starts).
segment.target: Audit Process Creation determines whether the operating system generates audit events when a process is created (starts).

segment.source: These audit events can help you track user activity and understand how a computer is being used.
segment.target: These audit events can help you track user activity and understand how a computer is being used.

segment.source: Information includes the name of the program or the user that created the process.
segment.target: Information includes the name of the program or the user that created the process.

segment.source: Event volume: Low to Medium, depending on system usage.
segment.target: Event volume: Low to Medium, depending on system usage.

segment.source: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated when a process is created or starts.
segment.target: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated when a process is created or starts.

segment.source: The name of the application and user that created the process is also audited.
segment.target: The name of the application and user that created the process is also audited.

segment.source: It is typically useful to collect Success auditing information for this subcategory for forensic investigations, to find information who, when and with which optionsparameters ran specific process.
segment.target: It is typically useful to collect Success auditing information for this subcategory for forensic investigations, to find information who, when and with which optionsparameters ran specific process.

segment.source: Additionally, you can analyse process creation events for elevated credentials use, potential malicious process names and so on.
segment.target: Additionally, you can analyse process creation events for elevated credentials use, potential malicious process names and so on.

segment.source: The event volume is typically medium-high level, depending on the process activity on the computer.
segment.target: The event volume is typically medium-high level, depending on the process activity on the computer.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: It is typically useful to collect Success auditing information for this subcategory for forensic investigations, to find information who, when and with which optionsparameters ran specific process.
segment.target: It is typically useful to collect Success auditing information for this subcategory for forensic investigations, to find information who, when and with which optionsparameters ran specific process.

segment.target: Additionally, you can analyse process creation events for elevated credentials use, potential malicious process names and so on.

segment.source: The event volume is typically medium-high level, depending on the process activity on the computer.
segment.target: The event volume is typically medium-high level, depending on the process activity on the computer.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: 4688(S): A new process has been created.
segment.target: 4688(S): A new process has been created.

segment.source: 4696(S): A primary token was assigned to process.
segment.target: 4696(S): A primary token was assigned to process.
